author: Michael Muldoon mmuldoon@eagletribune.com
title: Saluting our area’s Unsung Heroes
text:
Saluting our area’s Unsung Heroes 
Unsung Hero Julia Dello Russo plays soccer for Central Catholic Saluting our area’s Unsung Heroes 
Unsung Hero John Burgess runs for Haverhill. Saluting our area’s Unsung Heroes 
Unsung Hero Abi ScovottI plays field hockey for Haverhill Posted: Friday, October 16, 2015 12:00 am 
Saluting the overachievers, the quiet leaders and the often overlooked athletes in local high school sports. 
Coaches or ADs should send nominations to Unsung Heroes writer Michael Muldoon at mmuldoon@eagletribune.com . 
John Burgess 
Top of the Class 
Burgess is a young man of many talents. 
He’s ranked fifth overall in his class and he was named a National Merit Scholar Commended Student. Musically, he’s a big star in the Haverhill High drama club (suggestion: check out “A Christmas Carol” this winter) and sang the national anthem at the Haverhill Invitational track meet last spring. 
His whole family is musically inclined including his mother, Erin, the chorus director at Ward Hill Church. 
The 5-foot-10 cross country tri-captain may be the most improved Hillie. He’s been in the Hillies’ top five throughout the fall. 
John works at DiBurro’s and enjoys the movie “Jaws,” chocolate animal crackers, “Seinfeld,” actress Estelle Harris, Dustin Pedroia and art teacher Jeffrey Paszko. 
Julia Dello Russo 
Dello Russo has played every position except goalie. 
“Julia is our vocal leader at practice and a fan favorite,” said coach Casey Grange. 
The senior from Wilmington’s favorite athletic accomplishment is being named a tri-captain. She followed her sister, Olivia (CCHS ‘14), to Central. 
During the summer she worked for Andover dentist Dr. Lombardo. Dello Russo hopes to attend Mass. College of Pharmacy to study sonography. 
Julia has a dog, a miniature dachshund named Benny. Near the top of her bucket list is visiting the family’s home in Italy. 
Dello Russo’s favorites include the movie “A Walk to Remember,” the TV show “Grey’s Anatomy” and its McDreamy star Patrick Dempsey, soccer star Abby Wambach and English teacher Katie Andrade. 
ABI SCOVOTTI 
Haverhill Field Hockey 
Rough, Tough Hillie 
Scovotti won’t back down from anyone or anything. She battled mononucleosis in the preseason and to get ready for games she and her teammates like to play pick-up football. 
“When the ball goes into the defensive end, Abi is always there to make a key stop,” said coach Christopher Drew. 
Abi also plays lacrosse for the Brown and Gold. Her sister, Madeline (HHS ‘13), played field hockey and tennis. 
Abi is the manager of the girls’ hockey team and works at Carter’s Ice Cream. The National Honor Society student is looking to major in education with Michigan State, Clemson and South Carolina her favorite schools. 
She has two dogs, Bichons named Stella and Percy. 
Her favorite TV show is “Zoey 101” and her favorite movie is “Lilo and Stitch.” Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
